modules.description: This module manages HTTP/2 client connections over a provided socket, enabling sending requests, handling responses, and managing connection-level operations like pings and shutdowns. It works with H2 request and response types, along with client-specific error handlers and body writers. Concrete use cases include implementing HTTP/2-based API clients, streaming data with server push, and managing persistent connections with custom runtime behavior.

Implements HTTP/2 server logic using Lwt for asynchronous networking. Handles incoming connections with customizable request and error handlers, operating on socket values from the Server_runtime module. Ideal for building scalable web servers that require HTTP/2 support and non-blocking I/O operations.

This module provides HTTP/2 protocol support for Lwt-based applications, enabling both client and server implementations with asynchronous stream handling, header management, and frame processing. It centers around socket-based communication, using request and response types to manage bidirectional data exchange, with support for server push, custom error handling, and connection lifecycle operations. The client module facilitates API clients and streaming over HTTP/2, while the server module enables scalable, non-blocking web servers with customizable request processing. Example uses include high-performance microservice clients, persistent HTTP/2 connections with runtime control, and asynchronous web servers handling TLS and multiplexed streams.
